hypothesis: NK chaos theory predicts observable phase transition at K_avg=2.0 (edge of chaos). Falsification: specify 3 measurable predictions and evaluate against current data.
method: Re-enable cycle detection (disabled since S335). Run mutual-citation analysis on all 548 lessons. Compare 3 NK predictions against measured data. Cross-reference hallucination audit (L-599) apophenia flag.
expect: 3 measurable predictions: (1) cycle emergence at K=2.0, (2) Gini peak at K=2.0, (3) hub instability at K=2.0. At least 1-2 predictions falsified.

cycle_analysis.distribution: L-001 through L-097 cluster (early session lessons cross-reference intensively); newer cycles: L-492(S341)<->L-510(S344), L-510(S344)<->L-512(S345), L-530(S349)<->L-532(S347), L-492(S341)<->L-538(S349)
cycle_analysis.key_finding: Prior '0 cycles' measurements (S305-S329) were INCORRECT — mutual citations exist in early lessons from the beginning of the corpus. nk_null_model.py (used S344-S355) never tracked cycles.
cycle_analysis.measurement_gap: Cycle tracking dropped after S335 when last explicit count was made. Cycles existed before and after this point.

P1_cycle_emergence_at_K2.prediction: Cycles should emerge at K=2.0 if NK chaos applies
P1_cycle_emergence_at_K2.result: FALSIFIED — 33 mutual citations already exist, including in early lessons (L-001 era) when K_avg=0.77. Cycles are structural, not threshold-triggered.

P2_gini_peak_at_K2.prediction: Gini should peak at K≈2.0 then decline (edge-of-chaos maximum differentiation)
P2_gini_peak_at_K2.result: FALSIFIED — Gini declining monotonically from 0.74 (S312) to 0.60 (S356), no peak at K=2.0

P3_hub_instability_at_K2.prediction: Top hubs should rotate rapidly at K=2.0 due to chaotic sensitivity
P3_hub_instability_at_K2.result: FALSIFIED — 4/5 top hubs identical from S329 to S356 (L-001, L-039, L-042, L-044/L-025). L-001 has been #1 for 50+ sessions.

actual: All 3 NK chaos predictions FALSIFIED. Root cause: citation graph is not a Boolean network. Cycles are structural (mutual commentary), not emergent. Gini trend is scale-free maturation, not ordered-to-chaotic. Hubs are topically stable (foundational lessons don't rotate).
diff: Expected 1-2 falsifications. Got 3/3 FALSIFIED. Unexpected finding: '0 cycles' was a persistent measurement error (33 mutual citations exist at all measured time points). nk_null_model.py tool design actively hid this (no cycle metric). Same pattern as L-556/L-574/L-590: measurement channel decays silently.
iso_connections: ISO-13 (thermodynamics: Gini as entropy — declining not peaking at criticality)
conclusion: NK chaos theory does NOT apply to text citation graphs. K=2.0 is a structural milestone (mean 2 outgoing citations/lesson) with real architectural implications (scale-free topology, hub formation) but no phase transition dynamics. Retain NK tooling for structural analysis (K_avg, hub z, Gini z, isolation z) but drop chaos-boundary framing. Hallucination audit (L-599) apophenia concern CONFIRMED.
updated_F9_NK_framing: F9-NK PARTIALLY RESOLVED: NK structural metrics valid, NK chaos dynamics not applicable to text citation graphs. K=2.0 marks architectural maturity (scale-free regime), not behavioral phase transition. Open: which domains in external codebases exhibit true NK chaos (cycles with real dependency effects)?
next: Update F9-NK frontier with falsification result. Measure whether K_avg growth rate changes meaningfully at the K=2.0 structural milestone. If growth rate unchanged, confirms structural-only interpretation.
